Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_55850
DisplayedItem.title: Use the esophageal checklist if the tumor involves the EGJ and the tumor midpoint is 2 cm or less into the proximal stomach.

ListItem.name: LI_57616
ListItem.title: Poorly cohesive carcinoma (includes signet-ring cell carcinoma and other variants)

ListItem.name: LI_50002
ListItem.title: Mixed carcinoma (mixture of discrete glandular (tubular / papillary) and signet-ring / poorly cohesive cellular histological components)

ListItem.name: LI_26709
ListItem.title: Diffuse type (includes signet-ring carcinoma, classified as greater than 50% signet-ring cells)

ListItem.name: LI_26710
ListItem.title: Mixed (approximately equal amounts of intestinal and diffuse)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39425
DisplayedItem.title: # Select this option only if large cell or small cell cannot be determined.

ListItem.name: LI_26719
ListItem.title: Mixed adenocarcinoma-neuroendocrine carcinoma (small cell or large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma)

ListItem.name: LI_50583
ListItem.title: Carcinoma in situ (intraepithelial tumor without invasion of the lamina propria, high-grade dysplasia)

ListItem.name: LI_49355
ListItem.title: Penetrates subserosal connective tissue without invasion of visceral peritoneum or adjacent structures

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39474
DisplayedItem.title: # Intramural extension to the duodenum or esophagus is not considered invasion of an adjacent structure, but is classified using the depth of the greatest invasion in any of these sites.

ListItem.name: LI_44526
ListItem.title: Directly invades adjacent structure(s) or organ(s)#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_44526_1
Property.val: Directly invades adjacent structure(s) or organ(s)

Property.name: p_altTxt_52017_1
Property.val: Adjacent Site(s) Involved by Direct Tumor Extension

ListItem.name: LI_58137
ListItem.title: Present, with no viable cancer cells (complete response, score 0)

ListItem.name: LI_51582
ListItem.title: Present, with single cells or rare small groups of cancer cells (near complete response, score 1)

ListItem.name: LI_54138
ListItem.title: Present, with residual cancer showing evident tumor regression, but more than single cells or rare small groups of cancer cells (partial response, score 2)

ListItem.name: LI_52664
ListItem.title: Absent, with extensive residual cancer and no evident tumor regression (poor or no response, score 3)

Question.name: Q_7010
Question.title: Lymphatic and / or Vascular Invasion (Note F)

ListItem.name: LI_366742
ListItem.title: All margins negative for invasive carcinoma

Question.name: Q_366752
Question.title: Distance from Invasive Carcinoma to Closest Margin

ListItem.name: LI_366776
ListItem.title: Carcinoma in situ (high-grade dysplasia) present at margin

Question.name: Q_366792
Question.title: Margin(s) Involved by Carcinoma in Situ

ListItem.name: LI_11376
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_356375
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_356380
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_40902
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51682
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_51682_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327679
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_6958
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_37824
ListItem.title: pTis: Carcinoma in situ: intraepithelial tumor without invasion of the lamina propria, high-grade dysplasia

DisplayedItem.name: DI_47232
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa

ListItem.name: LI_6961
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37833
DisplayedItem.title: # A tumor may penetrate the muscularis propria with extension into the gastrocolic or gastrohepatic ligaments, or into the greater or lesser omentum, without perforation of the visceral peritoneum covering these structures. In this case, the tumor is classified as T3. If there is perforation of the visceral peritoneum covering the gastric ligaments or the omentum, the tumor should be classified as T4.

ListItem.name: LI_6963
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37834
DisplayedItem.title: ## The adjacent structures of the stomach include the spleen, transverse colon, liver, diaphragm, pancreas, abdominal wall, adrenal gland, kidney, small intestine, and retroperitoneum.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37835
DisplayedItem.title: ### Intramural extension to the duodenum or esophagus is not considered invasion of an adjacent structure, but is classified using the depth of the greatest invasion in any of these sites.

ListItem.name: LI_37829
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor penetrates the subserosal connective tissue without invasion of the visceral peritoneum or adjacent structures##, ###

DisplayedItem.name: DI_40614
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Tumor invades the serosa (visceral peritoneum) or adjacent structures##, ###

ListItem.name: LI_19571
ListItem.title: pT4a: Tumor invades the serosa (visceral peritoneum)

ListItem.name: LI_37832
ListItem.title: pT4b: Tumor invades adjacent structures / organs

ListItem.name: LI_820576
ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_58043
DisplayedItem.title: # Metastatic tumor deposits in the subserosal fat adjacent to a gastric carcinoma, without evidence of residual lymph node tissue, are considered regional lymph node metastases for purposes of gastric cancer staging.

ListItem.name: LI_327709
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_327710
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_6970
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_37839
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_37840
ListItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50650
DisplayedItem.title: pN3: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_37842
ListItem.title: pN3a: Metastasis in seven to 15 regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_37843
ListItem.title: pN3b: Metastasis in 16 or more regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_19578
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_19578_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_31534
DisplayedItem.title: For HER2 reporting, the CAP Gastric HER2 Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
